result.execSummary:
The defendant Arron J Rome was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample; pay surcharge. Pay all costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge during period of probation. If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant. Cash bail applied.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Arron J Rome

defendant.name: Rome, Arron J
defendant.address: S75W22610 Badger Trail, Big Bend, WI 53103

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 12/21/15 bail refund notice mailed to surety.

Defendant Arron J Rome in court with attorney Bruce B. Jacobson.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    
Defendant ordered to serve 4 months in the House of Correction.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 12 months with the following conditions:

*Defendant is to serve 30 days in the House of Correction, condition time.  Court STAYS report date to 12-26-2015 at 9:00 am. 
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.  No illegal drugs.
*Make diligent efforts to seek and maintain full time employment and/or school.
*Perform 20 hours of community service.
*Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.
*Defendant to pay all costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge, during period of probation.  Any bail on deposit to apply. If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.

filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Sentencing Referral Form
Per defense request, case adjourned to 12/14/2015 at 1:30 pm for a Plea and Sentencing date. Parties notified.

Defendant Arron J Rome in court with attorney Bruce B. Jacobson.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case heard off the record.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed. Due to this court being in trial, case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing in branch 45.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Arron J Rome in court with attorney Mark Tishberg for attorney Bruce B. Jacobson.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Arron J Rome in court with attorney Bruce B. Jacobson.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense requests a projected guilty plea date.  Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Lindsey Grady, Branch 23 in Courthouse room 515.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Arron J Rome in court with attorney Bruce B. Jacobson.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense requests additional time to review offer and discovery and requests another status conference date.  No objection from the State.  Parties are notified that effective June 8, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Reserve Judge, Branch 45 in Courthouse room 515.  Status conference scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

15RM021874  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
04/17/2015

Defendant Arron J Rome in court with attorney Bruce B. Jacobson.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Pretrial conference held.  Defense requests a status conference date. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 46.  Status conference scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Arron J Rome in court.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 46. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.   Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 46.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4-17-2015 at 1:30pm
